modules.description: This module exposes predefined color palettes from libraries like ColorBrewer, Microsoft Office, and Tableau as JavaScript-compatible objects, offering sequential, diverging, and qualitative schemes with 3–20 color steps. It works with data structures representing color gradients (e.g., YlGn, BrBG, Office Classic) and integrates with Chart.js via OCaml through `Js_of_ocaml`, enabling web-based visualizations. Specific use cases include applying perceptually balanced gradients for data series, categorical coloring in dashboards, and accessibility-focused palettes for diverging data ranges.

This module manages color schemes for Chart.js charts by creating, retrieving, and applying color configurations through `Js_of_ocaml`. It provides direct access to predefined palettes from libraries like ColorBrewer and Tableau, supporting sequential, diverging, and qualitative schemes with 3–20 color steps. Users can set global defaults, apply custom gradients to individual charts, or dynamically override color settings in web-based visualizations. Specific capabilities include integrating accessibility-focused color ranges, categorical dashboard coloring, and perceptually balanced gradients for data series.
